description: This creamy chicken enchilada soup delivers all the comfort of traditional enchiladas with none of the assembly frustration.
ingredients: [{"name": "olive oil", "units": "tablespoons", "amount": 2}, {"name": "yellow onion", "units": "large", "amount": 1}, {"name": "garlic", "units": "cloves", "amount": 3}, {"name": "boneless, skinless chicken breasts", "units": "pound", "amount": 1}, {"name": "ground cumin", "units": "teaspoons", "amount": 2}, {"name": "chili powder", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 1}, {"name": "smoked paprika", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 1}, {"name": "chicken broth", "units": "cups", "amount": 4}, {"name": "red enchilada sauce", "units": "can (10 ounces)", "amount": 1}, {"name": "diced green chiles", "units": "can (4 ounces)", "amount": 1}, {"name": "black beans", "units": "can (15 ounces)", "amount": 1}, {"name": "corn kernels", "units": "can (15 ounces)", "amount": 1}, {"name": "cream cheese", "units": "ounces", "amount": 4}, {"name": "heavy cream", "units": "cup", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "shredded Monterey Jack cheese", "units": "cup", "amount": 1}, {"name": "salt", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "black pepper", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 0.25}, {"name": "fresh cilantro", "units": "for garnish", "amount": null}]
instructions: 1. Heat olive oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add onion and sauté until translucent, 5-7 minutes. Add garlic and cook 1 minute more. 2. Add chicken breasts to the pot. Sprinkle with cumin, chili powder, and smoked paprika. Pour in chicken broth, enchilada sauce, and green chiles. Bring to a simmer, cover, and cook 15-20 minutes until chicken reaches 165°F internally. 3. Remove chicken to a plate and shred with two forks. Return shredded chicken to pot along with black beans and corn. Simmer 5 minutes. 4. Reduce heat to low. Add cream cheese and stir until completely melted, 3-4 minutes. Stir in heavy cream and shredded cheese until melted and creamy. 5. Season with salt and pepper. Ladle into bowls and garnish with fresh cilantro. Serve immediately.
notes: If you want to take your soup game from amateur to authority figure, consider using rotisserie chicken for an even faster version.
